### Steps to reproduce

with a file with the contents
```ruby
<<~"BASH"
  if the string inside is too short it doesn't crash
  but I haven't found exactly how many chars is the problem

  if the string inside is too short it doesn't crash
  but I haven't found exactly how many chars is the problem

  it needs this line
BASH
```

and with `pkgs.vimPlugins.nvim-treesitter.withAllGrammars` from recent nixpkgs-unstable in the start path but no other plugins

steps

1. nvim --clean file.rb
2. := vim.treesitter.start()
3. then remove the second quote mark (after the H in BASH)

neovim will print "Assertion failed: (size == length), function deserialize, file src/scanner.c, line 160." next to the quote mark and exit.




### Expected behavior

Do not crash

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0-nightly+6f1601a, Build type: Release, LuaJIT 2.1.1713773202

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

doesn't use treesitter

### Operating system/version

macOs 14.7

### Terminal name/version

wezterm 20240203-110809-5046fc22

### $TERM environment variable

wezterm

### Installation

https://github.com/nix-community/neovim-nightly-overlay

comment_data.body: Yes, this is a problem with the ruby parser and should be reported there; nothing we can do about it.
